solution.text:
(i) $2 \mathrm{Fe}_2 \mathrm{O}_3(\mathrm{~s}) \rightarrow 4 \mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{s})+3 \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g})$;
$\Delta_{\mathrm{r}} \mathrm{G}^{\circ}=+1487.0 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$
(ii) $2 \mathrm{CO}(\mathrm{g})+\mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{CO}_2$ (g)
$\Delta_{\mathrm{r}} \mathrm{G}^{\circ}=-514.4 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$
Multiple reaction (ii) with 3 , we get
(iii) $6 \mathrm{CO}(\mathrm{g})+3 \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 6 \mathrm{CO}_2(\mathrm{~g})$;
$\Delta_{\mathrm{r}} \mathrm{G}^{\circ}=3 \times-514.4=-1543.2 \mathrm{kJmol}^{-1}$
When we add reaction (i) and reaction
(iii), we get reaction (iv)
(iv) $2 \mathrm{Fe}_2 \mathrm{O}_3(\mathrm{~s})+6 \mathrm{CO}(\mathrm{g}) \longrightarrow$
$4 \mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{s})+6 \mathrm{CO}_2(\mathrm{~g})$
Free energy change, $\Delta_r G^{\circ}$ for the reaction will be
$$
1487.0-1543.2=-56.2 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}
$$
